bibl.note: This is a letter from Governor John Sevier dated May 6, 1796. The letter is to Colonels White, Kelly, and Weir. Sevier writes that he is going to be in Washington D.C. for about a month. He asks that the Colonels keep a close watch on the frontier and on the Cherokees.

div.p: I am under expectation that I shall be ready to sit out for washington, some time to day or early tomorrow morning shall I suppose be absent from this place, three or four weeks; In the mean time I beg you to have a watchfull watchful eye towards the frontiers, and their your neighbours neighbors the Cherokees.
If any thing of moment should occur, let me know by express as soon as possible

I am respectfully sir
your mo obedt sert most obedient servant
